content:
Mattoon is a small city, so it doesn't have as many well-known figures as larger cities might. However, there have been a few notable people from Mattoon over the years. Here are a few examples:

1. Burl Ives: Burl Ives was a folk singer, actor, and author who was born in Jasper County, near Mattoon, in 1909. He was known for his distinctive voice and his contributions to American folk music. He passed away in 1995.
2. John Malkovich: John Malkovich is an actor and director who was born in Christopher, Illinois, but spent much of his childhood in Benton, which is about an hour's drive from Mattoon. He is known for his work in films such as "Dangerous Liaisons," "Being John Malkovich," and "Bird Box."
3. William L. Enloe: William L. Enloe was a World War II hero who was born in Mattoon in 1917. He was awarded the Medal of Honor for his actions during the Battle of Okinawa, in which he single-handedly attacked and destroyed several enemy positions. He passed away in 1997.
4. Robert Ridgway: Robert Ridgway was an ornithologist who was born in Mount Carmel, Illinois, in 1850. He grew up in Mattoon and went on to become one of the most respected bird experts of his time. He passed away in 1929.
5. Michael Finke: Michael Finke is a retired professional basketball player who was born in Mattoon in 1952. He played for several teams in the National Basketball Association (NBA) during the 1970s and 1980s, including the Phoenix Suns, the Milwaukee Bucks, and the San Antonio Spurs.
